nominalpy.mqtt package

Submodules

nominalpy.mqtt.client module

class nominalpy.mqtt.client.Client(server: str = 'broker.hivemq.com')

Bases: object

This client acts as an MQTT interface with python, allowing for callbacks from topic subscriptions and publishing messages over topics. This acts as a wrapper for the Paho MQTT client, which must be installed to work correctly.

add_callback(topic: str, func: Callable[[str], None]) → None

Adds a particular function callback to the data when received over a topic. The callback function must be in the form of ‘def func (data: str)’. Multiple functions can be added to each topic and will execute each of the functions with the same data.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – The topic name that should have a callback with

  • func (Callable) – The callback function when the topic receives data, in the form of func (data: str)

callbacks: dict = {}

A mapping of topic to functions to callback as a dictionary.

client_name: str = ''

Defines the unique name of the client.

connect(wait: bool = False) → None

This method begins to connect to the server and makes sure that it will run until shutdown. If the wait flag is enabled, it will throttle the thread until a valid connection has been made.

Parameters:

wait (bool) – A flag whether to wait until the connection is reached and pause the thread

connected: bool = False

A flag for if the MQTT client is connected to the server.

fail: bool = False

A flag for if a failure to communicate with the server occurred.

publish(topic: str, data: str) → None

Publishes some data over a particular topic, assuming it is string data.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – The topic to publish the data over the MQTT connection

  • data (str) – The data to publish over the MQTT topic

publish_json(topic: str, data: dict) → None

Publishes some JSON data over a particular topic, assuming it is in the form of a dictionary or some other JSON configurable object.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – The topic to publish the data over the MQTT connection

  • data (dict) – The JSON value to publish over the MQTT topic

server: str = ''

Defines the name of the server being used to communicate with.

wait_for_connection(timeout: float = 3.0) → bool

Waits for a valid connection after calling connect. This will wait for a certain time until it time’s out and returns out of the loop.

Parameters:

timeout (float) – The timeout in seconds for the connection to wait for

Returns:

A valid connection flag if a connection has been reached

Return type:

bool

nominalpy.mqtt.client.HIVEMQ_SERVER: str = 'broker.hivemq.com'

The default MQTT server that is being used to communicate with the clients.

nominalpy.mqtt.client.SERVER_PORT: int = 1883

The default MQTT server port that is being used for the protocol.

nominalpy.mqtt.client.SERVER_TIMEOUT: int = 5

The server timeout in seconds to keep the connection alive for.
